Author: kingkongrevenge
Content:
> Python, like Ruby, Perl, and other relatively high level languages, has supports a dictionary (or hashtable if you prefer) data type at the syntax level.

Kind of a dumb point. STL has map and hash_map. Failing to use them has nothing to do with the language, just stupidity.

Author: copenja
Content:
I concur. I can't believe how many single monitor setups there are.

I am also surprised that more people don't use split screen setups where they can view multiple pages of code within the same window (ala emacs,gvim, Visual Studio). I prefer to have around four but atleast two views of code open at once.
